intro: Argyreia sumatrana, commonly known as the "Morning Glory of Sumatra," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically open in the morning. The plant has a climbing habit and produces heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers range in color from white to pink and blue, depending on the variety. Argyreia sumatrana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
